conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/isometric model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, readable room volumes, and the ceiling/roof removed to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clear wall thickness and multi-face geometry; good isometric viewing angle and clean cutaway. Minor simplification of some junction details/edges.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room configuration matches the 2D plan well: bedroom at top, toilet to the right, living/dining central-left, balcony left, kitchen/utility on the right, foyer at bottom. Some minor proportional/door-location simplifications relative to the precise 2D drawing.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (bed, sofa, dining), kitchen appliances/counter shown, and bathroom fixtures present. Some elements are simplified blocks and not all minor fittings/storage match the plan exactly.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry with clear walls/floors/openings and decent lighting. However, prominent text labels are embedded in the 3D view, reducing presentation cleanliness; minor style-driven simplification of details.

detected_errors.description: Some door/opening placements and proportions appear simplified compared to the 2D plan (not all swings/positions perfectly replicated).
Geometric detailing at certain wall junctions and interior built-ins is simplified, which can slightly reduce strict plan fidelity.
Text labels/dimensions are present in the 3D render, reducing presentation score.

summary: This is a valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong layout fidelity and clear interior volumes, with only minor proportional/opening simplifications and label/UI clutter.
